cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 380 miles SE of Galveston, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing WNW then turning NW–NNW toward the Upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Texas-Louisiana border (Sabine Pass / Cameron LA area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch east of Intracoastal City LA to west of Morgan City LA; Storm-surge watch Freeport TX to San Luis Pass TX and east of the Mississippi River mouth
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning San Luis Pass TX to Intracoastal City LA; Storm-surge warning San Luis Pass TX to the mouth of the Mississippi River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas coast and southwest Louisiana coast including Sabine Lake and Calcasieu Lake
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force winds (possibly 100–110 mph) likely in the Beaumont/Port Arthur area Wednesday night into Thursday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Life-threatening surge of 9–14 ft possible in Sabine Lake and adjacent coast (includes Beaumont waterway approaches)
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches with locally 15 inches causing flash and urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Scattered tornadoes beginning Wednesday evening; dangerous rip currents and large destructive waves on approaches
